etymologies: mid 19th century. From scientific Latin promethea, specific name (in Phalaena promethea; D. DruryIllustr. Nat. Hist II. 18), feminine of classical Latin Promēthēus (adjective) of or associated with Prometheus from Promētheus

definitions: In full "promethea moth". A large North American saturniid silk moth, Callosamia promethea, the male of which has dark brown wings with pale margins.
